Markus, can you try again. Problem persists (Build id: 200307230800). Additional settings to reproduce: - Preferences > Java > Work in progress: Check "Enable Lightbulb ..." - Preferences > Java > Editor > Templates: Check "Use code formatter" - Preferences > Java > Line Splitting: Set "Maximum line length" to 80 Possible reason: Code formatter doesn't preserve line breaks. Maybe this generates invalid positions for the hover help. works for me using I20031120 I20031120: still erroneous if Preferences > Java > Work in Progress > New Code Formatter is enabled. Now, I get no CoreException, but a log entry. Steps: - enable new code formatter - enable Java > Editor > Templates > Use code formatter - open Protectable.java from jUnit - Ctrl+A, Ctrl+1 -> error in log: Error Nov 21, 2003 16:23:10.587 formatter failed to format (no edit returned). Will use unformatted text instead. kind: 0, string: do { package junit.framework; /** * A Protectable can be run and can throw a Throwable. * * @see TestResult */ public interface Protectable { /** * Run the the following method protected. */ public abstract void protect() throws Throwable; } } while (condition); Would you mind not always changing the steps and reopen? The error is clearey another one: the formatter was not able to format. Please file a bug against the formatter.
